trans-unit.source: Defines a class for SQL execution exceptions in the <xref href="System.Web.Management"></xref> namespace.
This class is provided as a means to differentiate SQL execution exceptions from other application exceptions.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Management.SqlExecutionException"></xref> class using default values.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Management.SqlExecutionException"></xref> class using the passed message.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Management.SqlExecutionException"></xref> class using the passed message and exception.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> encountered.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Management.SqlExecutionException"></xref> class.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The SQL Server instance against which the SQL commands are run.
The database against which the SQL commands are run.
The name of the installation file containing the SQL commands being run.
The SQL commands being run when the exception occurred.
The <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlException"></xref> encountered when processing the SQL commands.
Gets the SQL commands being run when the exception occurred.
The SQL commands being run when the exception occurred.
Gets the name of the database being accessed when the exception occurred.
The name of the database being accessed when the exception occurred.
Gets the exception encountered when processing the SQL commands.
The <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlException"></xref> encountered when processing the SQL commands.
Allows the exception to be serialized.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object to use.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> object to use.
Gets the SQL Server instance being accessed when the exception occurred.
The name of the SQL Server instance being accessed when the exception occurred.
Gets the path and name of the file containing the SQL commands being run when the exception occurred.
The path and name of the file that contains the SQL commands being run when the exception occurred.
